poem:
"Morning's Alchemy"

Brown sugar blooms,
Next to egg white rivers,
Palms of the diligent cook
Teeming with humble conquest.

Complete consumption is sought;
Stems, roots, leaves declared,
Savoring all, leaving naught,
Kale stalks humbly paired.

The dish emerges, sweeter still,
Transmuting excess into delight.
See how common fragments distill
Into ritual at morning's light.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "How to turn excess egg whites into brown-sugar meringues – recipe As a root-to-fruit cook, I like to practise what I call complete consumption and whenever possible eat the whole ingredient, including the root, skin, stem, leaves and everything in between. My ultimate goal is to use the whole ingredient in a single dish, leaving no byproduct. That can be as simple as finely chopping kale stalks so they can be steamed alongside the leaves,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
